Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2013 07:27AM Surrealist65 wrote: Hello, March People!  I had surgery yesterday and have been reading your posts with great interest.  Mine was pretty un-traumatic compared to a lot of you, I think, and I wish everyone's was as easy.  The process was bad, of course - all the waiting around really takes it out of you psychologically, but the physical aftermath of surgery has so far been almost painless.  Lumpectomy site is "no pain" in a cotton bra.  Node removal site is tiny, but twinging, like a pinch.  Should be survivable with just ibuprofen.  Everyone please, take care of yourselves and keep in touch!  This is a wonderful place to tell the truth about what's going on in your head, something I have not found entirely possible even with my closest relatives.
Posts.Title: March 2013 Surgeries kap Maureen1
